definition: at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan

sentences.english: The speed of change is rapid, the statistics bewildering.
sentences.chinese: 變化速度之快，令統計工作手足無措。

sentences.english: Don't you see that he has losen his head?
sentences.chinese: 難道，你沒看到他手足無措的樣子？

sentences.english: In my fumbled excitement, I misdialed my brother's phone number three times.
sentences.chinese: 由於激動得手足無措，我三次錯撥了弟弟的電話號碼。

sentences.english: The announcement left investors feeling wronged and wrong-footed.
sentences.chinese: 該聲明讓投資者覺得憋屈和手足無措。

sentences.english: When RongTian etc, to manage to brother won idea to tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 當榮田等人手足無措時，至嬴主意向兄長說出真相。

sentences.english: Ifyou start fidgeting with your leg you’ll soon start to feel nervous oranxious.
sentences.chinese: 如果你開始手足無措，你就開始緊張了。

sentences.english: Rampant free enterprise also lives uncomfortably alongside the country’s official ideology.
sentences.chinese: 猖獗的自由企業在國家的官方意識形態下也手足無措。

sentences.english: You got me chasin' rabbits, walkin' on my hands and howlin' at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 是你讓我心煩意亂，手足無措，對着月亮長吁短嘆。

sentences.english: When confronted with financial storm, are you at a loss?
sentences.chinese: 面對席捲而來的金融風暴，您是否手足無措？

sentences.english: But his first few months in Beijing were a shock.
sentences.chinese: 但是，最初在北京的幾月委實讓人感到手足無措。
傑克張口結舌，手足無措。

definition: embarrassed
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
hanging one's head dispiritedly (idiom); dejected/crestfallen
to sigh/to heave a sigh
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
to be unable to breathe
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
confused/flustered
in a difficult situation/to cut a sorry figure/scoundrel! (derog.)
not knowing which course to follow (idiom); at a loss what to do
unwilling
timidity/timid/cowardly
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
not in good condition/wrong/fishy
